p.Students completing the Forensic Science: Students completing the Forensic Science - Biochemistry Track B.S. degree will also meet the requirements for ACS certification. This track is designed to align students with specific courses necessary for the examination of DNA and other biochemical evidence. Students should be advised that background checks similar to those required for law enforcement officers are likely to be a condition of employment (Reference: NIJ Report NCJ 203099).

li.Students who change degree programs and: Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog.
li.Departmental Residency Requirement consi: Departmental Residency Requirement consists of at least 30 semester hours of regularly scheduled 3000-4000 level courses taken from the UCF Department of Chemistry.
li.Prior to enrolling in Chemistry and Math: Prior to enrolling in Chemistry and Math, you must take the Chemistry Placement Test and Math Placement Test ~ https://www.sdes.ucf.edu/placement-tests/
li.Co-op credit cannot be used in this majo: Co-op credit cannot be used in this major.
li.Students should consult with a departmen: Students should consult with a departmental advisor.
li.Students must earn a \"C\" (2.0) or high: Students must earn a "C" (2.0) or higher in each course and have a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA in all courses in Common Program Prerequisites, Core Requirements: Basic Level, Core Requirements: Advanced Level, and Restricted Electives.
li.All prerequisites of courses taught with: All prerequisites of courses taught within the College of Sciences will be enforced.
li.Courses designated in Common Program Pre: Courses designated in Common Program Prerequisites are usually completed in the first 60 hours.

courseSection0.text:
Students completing the Forensic Science - Biochemistry Track B.S. degree will also meet the requirements for ACS certification. This track is designed to align students with specific courses necessary for the examination of DNA and other biochemical evidence. Students should be advised that background checks similar to those required for law enforcement officers are likely to be a condition of employment (Reference: NIJ Report NCJ 203099).

Degree Requirements
Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog.
Departmental Residency Requirement consists of at least 30 semester hours of regularly scheduled 3000-4000 level courses taken from the UCF Department of Chemistry.
Prior to enrolling in Chemistry and Math, you must take the Chemistry Placement Test and Math Placement Test ~ https://www.sdes.ucf.edu/placement-tests/
Co-op credit cannot be used in this major.
Students should consult with a departmental advisor.
Students must earn a "C" (2.0) or higher in each course and have a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA in all courses in Common Program Prerequisites, Core Requirements: Basic Level, Core Requirements: Advanced Level, and Restricted Electives.
All prerequisites of courses taught within the College of Sciences will be enforced.
Courses designated in Common Program Prerequisites are usually completed in the first 60 hours.

courseSection0.text0: At least one course completed in each Foundation area must be a designated State General Education Core Course. See the catalog GEP description for more information.
courseSection0.text1: Certain courses must be selected for this degree that will bring the total hours of the GEP to more than 36.

CCJ3014, CCJ3024, CJE4012, CJE4610

li.Students must earn a \"C\" (2.0) or high: Students must earn a "C" (2.0) or higher in each course and have a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA in all courses in Common Program Prerequisites, Core Requirements: Basic Level, Core Requirements: Advanced Level, and Restricted Electives.
li.All attempts of courses taken that could: All attempts of courses taken that could meet major requirements are included in the GPA calculation.
li.Additional courses that could meet requi: Additional courses that could meet requirements but are taken beyond the minimum required (e.g., additional restricted electives) and a "C" (2.0) or better is earned are also included in both GPA calculations.
li.42 semester hours of upper division cred: 42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
li.60 semester hours earned after CLEP awar: 60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
li.30 of the last 39 hours of course work m: 30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
li.A maximum of 45 hours of extension, corr: A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
li.Complete the General Education Program,: Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.
li.Application and admissions through The B: Application and admissions through The Burnett Honors College and department. More information about Honors in the Major can be found at https://honors.ucf.edu/research/.
li.Students should consult with a departmen: Students should consult with a departmental advisor.
li.Contact your college advisor in the Coll: Contact your college advisor in the College of Sciences Advising Services (COSAS) office (CSB 250) for more information about overall progress toward your degree, GEP and other university requirements, academic probation, special problems as well as general academic advising.
li.Lower division courses do not substitute: Lower division courses do not substitute for upper division courses.
li.Courses transferred from private and out: Courses transferred from private and out-of-state schools must be evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide all supporting information.
li.Submit your requests for course evaluati: Submit your requests for course evaluations at https://sciences.ucf.edu/cosas/ and click on "COS Course Evaluation"..
li.Acceptable Substitutes for Transfer Cour:
Acceptable Substitutes for Transfer Courses
CHM 2045C: may use CHM 2040 plus CHM 2041.
Calculus: Although other math classes may satisfy the CPP, the specified courses are required in the major and still must be taken.
Physics: Although other courses may satisfy Organic Chemistry in the CPP, all the specified courses are required in the major and must be taken.

courseSection0.text:
Total Undergraduate Credit Hours Required: 124
Foreign Language Requirements
Graduation
None
Departmental Exit Requirements
Students must earn a "C" (2.0) or higher in each course and have a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA in all courses in Common Program Prerequisites, Core Requirements: Basic Level, Core Requirements: Advanced Level, and Restricted Electives.
All attempts of courses taken that could meet major requirements are included in the GPA calculation.
Additional courses that could meet requirements but are taken beyond the minimum required (e.g., additional restricted electives) and a "C" (2.0) or better is earned are also included in both GPA calculations.
University Minimum Exit Requirements
A 2.0 UCF GPA
42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.
Honors In Major
Application and admissions through The Burnett Honors College and department. More information about Honors in the Major can be found at https://honors.ucf.edu/research/.
Related Programs
Forensic Science, Chemistry Track (B.S.)
Chemistry (B.S.)
Biomedical Sciences (B.S.)
Chemistry Minor
Biomedical Sciences Minor
Advising Notes
Students should consult with a departmental advisor.
Contact your college advisor in the College of Sciences Advising Services (COSAS) office (CSB 250) for more information about overall progress toward your degree, GEP and other university requirements, academic probation, special problems as well as general academic advising.
Transfer Notes
Lower division courses do not substitute for upper division courses.
Courses transferred from private and out-of-state schools must be evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide all supporting information.
Submit your requests for course evaluations at https://sciences.ucf.edu/cosas/ and click on "COS Course Evaluation"..
Acceptable Substitutes for Transfer Courses
CHM 2045C: may use CHM 2040 plus CHM 2041.
Calculus: Although other math classes may satisfy the CPP, the specified courses are required in the major and still must be taken.
Physics: Although other courses may satisfy Organic Chemistry in the CPP, all the specified courses are required in the major and must be taken.
Program Academic Learning Compacts
Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm
Equipment Fees
Part-Time Student: $45 per term
Full-Time Student: $90 per term
